Replies.Reply: Top that off for ya, Hon?
Don't start in on me, Les. I couldn't get the pickup started and Harlan took the Dodge.
Holy Hell. My one shot at winding up on "Cops" and I'm in my weekday boots!
He was a quiet guy. Normal. Liked to read fishing magazines. Not much of a tipper.
That's weird. Guy was in here better part of an hour. We had a real pleasant chat... But I can't remember a thing about him. For the life of me. Couldn't even tell you what color his eyes were.
That one's easy. It's still in the lot.
The Bonneville out there with the awful paint job.
I'm... in restaurant supplies. I didn't get your name?
I don't mean to be rude but--
Listen, I don't know who you are but you can't--
I'm having a problem - with another customer. I'd like you to ask him to leave, please.
I have some money. It's not a lot but--
Please, Mister - what do you want from me?
Like I said, I never really saw him.
Got a spot set up for you, Tom.

Ms. Potter's the nice girl you met at the desk. She puts a package together for all the new agents, things to know about the area, help with finding apartments and such. This one's yours:  Charlton stops at a CUBICLE: Carpeted walls, formica desk. A corner of dull Hell. Mackelway eyes it, fighting dread.
Not so different from Dallas, is it?
Mackelway! You gonna sit on your ass all day, or do you wanna do something?
Did the right thing, Agent Mackelway.
Agent Mackelway. I was 'bout to introduce you, but I understand that won't be necessary.
Seems your former office has decided we might need some help on this one. So they sent out Agent Kulok.
I guess we're skipping the tearful reunion. Have a seat, Tom.
Okay. So our guy likes to draw pictures of body parts and then spring 'em on people. What's that get us?
Oh. 'Fore I forget. This came in for you:  He tosses a 9-by-12 ENVELOPE at Mackelway, who opens it. Six sheets of paper slide out.
Might wanna find yourself a fender.
No. Starkey's the one on the ground.
Whadda we know about the map?
Any of these bodies been recovered?
Either of the bodies have the zero on them?
We're gonna need everything you can remember about this guy, Tom. Physical description, any kind of distinguishing characteristics.
The suspect fled. Couple janitors walked in on it.
They're fine. But the description they gave of him wasn't worth a damn.
Case you're curious the real Professor Daitz is on sabbatical, out of the country. We can't find him.
Whose idea was it to meet there?
Uh-huh. Did he ask you to come alone?
But you figured you'd get a bigger pat on the head if you wrapped this whole thing up without any help - is that it?
Did Agent Mackelway attend the interview unaccompanied?
You wanna work alone, start your own agency.
Listen to me Cowboy. You have any idea the kind of favors I had to pull with the Abilene cops to cover your ass?!
Breaking and ENTERING the Speck house without a shred of evidence and NO WARRANT?!
Ever ask yourself why a big shot agent from Dallas gets sent down to the Wichita Falls Field Office? I'll give you TWO WORDS... Hell I'll even write it down for ya.
"EVIDENTIARY PROCEDURE." Don't talk about it. Learn it.
Turns out you were right about this guy.
Okay. We've got a serial killer of serial killers.

He's a transient with a history of mental illness. He also happens to think he's a former agent of this Bureau. And he is pursuing something that he calls "Suspect Zero." Anybody got anything intelligent to say?
Got one of those pins in Denton yet?
O'Ryan was spotted there tonight. Took a squad-car and a side-arm from a State Trooper. 'Bout an hour later a five-year old boy was abducted, roughly a mile up the Interstate.
The vehicle was found in an abandoned lot. We're establishing a perimeter around the city now.
Ya know what? I'm getting extremely tired of hearing that word. In fact, that's gonna be policy from now on. No Zero.
What're you saying - that all these abductions are the work of one guy? Do you know how fucking insane that is?!

Not let's try something that actually makes sense: He sends in these faxes, picks off three scumbags. For what?! So we'll think exactly what you're thinking right now - that we've got a friend out there, somebody willing to take out the garbage for the rest of us. And it's all horse-shit!
Fuck's sake, Mackelway - when did you start buying into this guy?!
I'd say you'd watched too many "X-Files."
I'm going to Denton at Oh-Six-Hundred.
It's not a strength of his. I'm noticing that lately.
You oughtta sit him down, remind him how a chain-of-command works.
You guys ever heard of evidentiary procedure?
Sort of a... stickler for procedure.
How's things back at the ranch?
I don't think so, no. I think it was pushed.
The look of the tracks. Foot-prints near the embankment.
What can you tell us about the other man?
We ought to work out some kind of protocol.
Interviews. Witnesses. Looks pretty silly, our talking over one another.
It's a metaphor - to make certain the victim sees... or to make certain that we see something.
Or maybe it's just a fuck-you.
You're not wearing your ring anymore.
Did he have access to those?
Would you mind opening them for me?
He was here... seven years you said?
I ran the name through our database, just to be sure. There's never been an Agent Benjamin O'Ryan in the Bureau.
Is that what you called him? Benjamin?
They assured me that they understood protocol.
The guy who used to stay upstairs.
Oh. I mis-spoke. No, he's not dead...
He ever talk about this? A circle with a slash through it?
It matches the faxes, Sir. Almost perfectly.
Only city where the date on the fax and the date on the map didn't correspond.
But both bodies were found over a thousand miles from where they'd last been seen. One in Montana, the other in Oregon. Got autopsy reports on both.
Yeah. Criminal Psych. I've been trading e-
Is that something you believe in, Professor? Evil?
I can't get a read on this guy.
Why is he sending us all this shit? I've got 800 pins in that map, 800 missing people. What's he telling us?
He kills a travelling salesman, then a school-teacher. Then Starkey? It doesn't connect.
I'm fine. I'm clear. I just didn't think this could wait. Fran, this guy is trying to point us at something. Starkey's part of it. But the other two don't connect.

I'm fine! I just need somebody to think this through with me! He wanted to meet me. It's like he was interviewing me somehow. What is that? Then he kills Starkey. So what was he doing with Speck and Fulcher?
No. No. You come out. Get dressed.
I dunno. Somewhere. We're right on the edge of this thing.
Mrs. Speck. Just had a few more questions.
Oh. There was one other thing: Did he keep any kind of chemicals around the house? Acids, that sort of thing?
It's nothing. Trace elements we found on his trunk. Any interest in chemistry?
Anyway, thank you. And thanks for the coffee. Next time I'll call first, I promise.
The sample I took from Speck's bumper...
It was SPECK not his killer who was hiding something.
O'Ryan. He left his file on my doorstep.
I'm look at his whole history!
Zero's a myth. You made him up.
Is that... possible, Sir? An agent can just be deleted?
I couldn't understand it before - pushing Speck's car onto the state line. Makes sense now. He wanted to make the case Federal. He's drawing us in.
So we'd be paying attention when he found Suspect Zero.

Sir, profile the guy. He's straight outta Quantico. All he's doing is working a case, like we would. He's not kidnapping little kids - he's chasing the guy who's doing the kidnapping! Look at the map!
What if it isn't? What if there really is a Zero out there and O'Ryan's the one guy who's got a shot at him?
Sir? What if I told you I knew how to catch him?
locate him, without ever leaving this building, what would you say?
Y'ever heard of a project called "Icarus," Sir?
Agents, trained to "see" distant locations using nothing but the mind.
Army stole it from the Soviets. The Bureau stole it from the Army - used it to track serial killers.
Experimental program. O'Ryan was the first agent they recruited.

He'd never been in that house before. He just saw what was in there - the Bureau taught him how... same one that deleted him. Same one that's trying to catch him now... Does anything about all this strike you as odd?
Sometimes. The lucky ones get sent to Wichita Falls.
Friend of the Receptionist, missing for about a year now. I told her I'd let her know if the body ever turned up.
Yeah. Last night. Kid named Simms.
Need an address on this fax line.
Zero comes back to the same spot, once a year. Today's the 25th.
I saw it before but it didn't register.
I dunno. Almost looks too symmetrical to be a burn.
He sent a fax from this location 'bout seven o'clock this morning.
Are your faxes programmable? Could he have paid last night to have it sent this morning?
So... he keeps the bodies in a freezer, then buries them...?
Just some coffee, thanks. Might hit the buffet in a bit.
Why would you be doing that?
I'll order some lunch for you. Hear the meatloaf's good today.
Enough of this shit. Where's the boy?
They all wind up like you? The other agents?
Can't bring you in with me. You know that.
He comes home on his birthday.
Travelling due west now. Don't see a name. It's a service road, running parallel to the--
Get the van open! He's got a kid in the van!
I want you to think for a second. About your destiny. Who you are. You're cursed, like I am - except you keep running from it.
You hear things. You see things. That's why you can't sleep, why your head always aches.
I'm not going to kill you, O'Ryan.
Stop telling me about my fucking destiny!
Open your eyes, O'Ryan! Here I am, standing here. I'm not shooting you.
Put the fucking thing down, O'Ryan.
I'm not going to kill you!
Gonna make a wallet-size of that one?
I called. They don't open for another hour.
Fax came in for you. It's the room next door.
It's Navajo. A song for dead warriors. I never played it for anybody before.
Just had a feeling you'd like it.
I dunno. The way you stare when you think nobody's looking.
Somethin', huh? Guy with a wife and kids keepin' bodies in his attic?
Yeah. Just... Wondered if you could do me a favor.
Her name's Karen Sumpter. We were friends.
She disappeared last year. Nobody knows where. She was a little wild, but not like that.
Anyway, I know you're gonna be in on the autopsies - of the girls they found over at Speck's. Figured you might see if one of 'em was...
If it is, I'd like to be the one to notify her folks. Out families've been friends for years.
Fella's name is Harold Speck. Traveling salesman, from Abilene.
Where the hell'd you find this guy?
So what the hell's he doin' here?
Hey Jumbo. Toss me down a crowbar.
I'm sorry I don't have more time, Agent Mackelway. It's my PTA Day.
I hope I was of some help.
A friend of mine said I'll feel like this one month for every year we were together. Sort of a grieving rule-of-
Picked up a foot-print in the back seat of Speck's car, size-and-a-half bigger than Speck's.
Wounds on Speck's throat indicate that he was strangled from behind... I think our guy waited for him in the backseat, sprung this on him once the car was moving.
Lab picked up talcum traces on the edges of the paper, consistent with powdered gloves.
So he gets the dropped in his lap, it spooks him, and the car winds up in the ravine.
Happen to see what he was driving?
Fine. I'll handle them from now on.
No other signs of torture here. Why take somebody's eyelids off?
Got nothing on the last fax.
Came from a business center at a Mariott in Dallas. Nobody saw who sent it.
He could be sending these to any agent in any office in the country... But he's sending them to you. Why?
Do you know a professor named Daitz? Says he's from Tulane.
Sir, I'm the one who took the call. Agent Mackelway was acting under the assumption that I'd already checked the guy out.
I'm going back to bed. You're welcome to the couch if you want. I think you could do with some sleep.
Females - Logan, Utah; and Decatur, Alabama.
She slides over a packet of PHOTOS: two FEMALE VICTIMS, photographed in separate morgues - face up, face down, waist and above, waist and below, etc.
Replies.Didascalie: (Neither city is represented with black pins on that map.)

Replies.Reply: So is this what happens when an agent spins out? He gets deleted?
I see you got the blue pin out of Greenville.
No. I meant her. The girl.
Did ya look at her vitals?
Wait. When did we establish that Zero was real?
It's not a burn. It's a freezer-burn.

There's crystallization in the blood stream. The blood never clotted in the wound. It's a freezer burn... I'm having the other body shipped out - the guy from Trenton. We'll see if he's got the same thing.
I dunno. If he kept them in a freezer they'd have marks like this all over.
I think agents are safer when they have some company. I can send along Katie if you'd rather.
A-may-zing Grace, How sweet the sound--
Off and on. It's not uncommon for our guests to vanish for months at a time.
No... but as elaborate fantasies go, it was one of my favorites.
And he always seemed so sincere about it.
It's what he wished to be called.
He painted one of the walls in his room, too.
I guess you fellas're never unaccounted for, huh?
That's not a circle. It's a zero.
I'll have a seven and seven, please.
It's in the car. No one's asked me for it for a couple years now.
I don't think the eyes are right.
No, they were... I don't really know.
Little cute for my taste, but I can stand three minutes of it.
Seven and seven. Got some i.d.?
If ya hurry, you'll still catch the end of the song.
How the fuck should I know?
Oh. I'm sorry. I was looking for Professor--
Hey! You! What're you doing down here!
Girls, I want you to come in now.
He's inside! He's inside! Went in through the back!
Mind stepping out of the car, please?
Take the weapon off your hip, place it on the ground, and kick it toward me.
What exactly were you planning on hunting, Sir?
Had anything to drink tonight, Sir? Under medication of any kind?
Sir, I'm going to ask you to hand me the keys to your vehicle, please.
Charlie?! Charlie, where are you, Honey?!
Charlie?! Honey, are you out here?!
Naah. I never saw that guy in here.
Nope. Haven't done nights since I got promoted.
You want some more breakfast, Honey, or are we just rollin' right on into lunch?
I told you she'd be here.
He's been a brat all morning.
Glad you're here, Man. Guy was about to kill me.
